title: Two profile issue
content: I have two firefox accounts. one for my university and other for my personal use. Ive been using G-mail as the primary email website for bothe the accounts. since Google chrome is lagging my system, i decides to use both the accounts in firefox. But firefox isn't allowing me to easily swith between two accounts without typing the password. also i would like to sign in my gmail in each account without typing the password. What i mean to say is, when I switch to my persoanl account, when i open G-mail, i want all the mails related to my personal account. and whenever i switch to my university account, i want all the mails related to university. with out separately signing in. but here whenever i open gmail via my university account, here all i recive are my personal mails and i dont want that. also the bookmarks which i have saved in my personal account, i dont want that to appear in whenever i swtch to my university account. also the saved password must belong to its account and shouldnever be merged.

I now have X's Bookmark toolbar on Y. Looked at settings and nothing apparent on how to stop this happening.

> Can I restore toolbar bookmarks on Y in one click, vs having to redo? > Is there a way to syc only one folder between computers - don't see that?

To be clear, I mainly deleted bookmarks on X, and added a couple. Y's Toolbar currently shows exactly as X was left off this morn. Any Help Appreciated

title: Trouble logging into certain accounts
content:
When trying to pay monthly premiums, certain web sites/companies do not recognize my username and password. A few other web sites cannot process my credit card information. Some web sites do not recognize my captcha response even though it is correct. I can use MS Edge without any problems on the same web sites.

My privacy setting is set at 'standard'. I've uninstalled Firefox and reinstalled the program several times to no avail. I've shut of all/any option to allow everything to be received e.g. popups, tracking, cookies, etc. I've cleared all cache, cookies, etc from the browser but still have the problem.

I've been told by one company that their online software does not work with Firefox.

If I can't use Firefox on a few web sites then I will be forced to change browsers and after 10, or more, years of committing to the Firefox browser I really don't want to start over with another browser.

title: User sel3ected colors not honoured since recent update.
content:
Due to recent changes in FireFox, user selected colors for background, text and links are no longer honored, even though the "Always" option is selected. Instead, it applies System Color, even though that option is not ticked.

This is a major problem for me, because I am light sensitive due to Chronic migraine, and the white backgrounds that are common cause me physical pain to look at.

content:
